page.title: 17FARMING SHEEP IN BIRCH
page.content: { Lukes Farm}is part of the Birch Estate and has 100 acres of grassland. The sheep are managed by a shepherd with the help of two students from an agriculural college. About 300{ewes}were kept at the farm 100 Scotch Halfbreeds,55 Mules which had speckled faces and 145 cross Clun Forest. The ewes are taken into a large pen just before they are about to give birth to their{lambs.}Whan the lambs have been born they are put into a small pen with their mothers for five days whilst their progress is carefully monitored. Eventually they are moved to larger pens inside open barns where they mix with other ewes and lambs. After one month they are finally put out into fields. At the end of the lambing season about{700 lambs}will have been{born.
